summary: This bill, the Conrad State 30 and Physician Access Reauthorization Act, aims to incentivize physicians to practice in underserved and rural communities. It extends and modifies the Conrad State 30 program, which provides waivers for foreign medical graduates, and makes changes to immigration laws affecting physicians, including streamlining employment protections, clarifying national interest waivers, and establishing reporting requirements. The bill also addresses physician employment agreements and visa status while working in underserved areas.
